tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:white male aged 34 yrs presents with severe headache since hitting the back of the head a short time ago. he also reports mild vomiting, moderate nausea, Traumatic Injury - Blunt associated with the severe headache. he had 16 min LOC. o:Height 181 cm, Weight 66.4 kg, Temperature 37.3 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 73, Respiration 18, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Acetaminophen - 650 mg po/pr q 6 hrs PRN pain, performed MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

content2.Unmatched: , MRI Brain Unremarkable , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex , appears

Value.Value: MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

td.content: s:34 year old white male probation officer presents for 6 days f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 16 min). he denies vomiting, nausea and headache since the accident. he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. Denies ever using tobacco he denies drinking alcohol o:Height 181 cm, Weight 65.8 kg, Temperature 37.3 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 18, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: Denies ever using tobacco he denies drinking alcohol
No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,
